name: Backpack
description: A sturdy backpack made of durable fabric, designed to carry supplies and equipment for adventurers. It features multiple compartments and adjustable straps for comfort and convenience.

name: Rations (iron or standard)
description: Rations are pre-packaged food supplies designed to sustain adventurers during their journeys. Iron rations are durable and can last for weeks without spoiling, while standard rations are more palatable but have a shorter shelf life. Both types provide essential nutrients to keep adventurers energized and ready for battle.

name: Waterskin
description: A waterskin is a flexible container made from leather or other durable materials, designed to hold liquids, primarily water. It is essential for adventurers to stay hydrated during long journeys in the wilderness.

name: Torch
description: A torch is a simple yet essential tool for adventurers, made of a wooden stick with a flammable material at one end. When lit, it provides a steady source of light, illuminating dark areas and helping to ward off creatures that lurk in the shadows.

name: Lantern
description: A lantern is a portable light source, typically made of metal and glass, designed to hold a flame or a magical light. It provides illumination in dark places, making it essential for adventurers exploring caves, dungeons, or during nighttime travels.

name: Rope (hemp or silk)
description: A sturdy length of rope made from either durable hemp or luxurious silk, used for climbing, securing objects, or creating makeshift shelters. The hemp rope is rough and strong, while the silk rope is lighter and more flexible, making it suitable for various adventuring needs.

name: Grappling Hook
description: A grappling hook is a metal device with multiple prongs, designed to be thrown or launched to secure a rope to a distant object, allowing adventurers to scale walls, cross chasms, or retrieve items from hard-to-reach places.

name: Lockpicks
description: A set of finely crafted metal tools designed for manipulating the internal mechanisms of locks, allowing skilled individuals to unlock doors and chests without the original key. Often used by rogues and thieves, these tools are essential for stealthy adventurers.

name: Crowbar
description: A crowbar is a sturdy metal tool with a curved end, designed for prying, lifting, and breaking apart objects. It is often used by adventurers to open locked doors, remove obstacles, or as a makeshift weapon in desperate situations.

name: Climbing Gear
description: Climbing gear includes essential equipment such as pitons, carabiners, and a harness, designed to ensure safety and support during ascents and descents in rugged terrains. The gear is made from durable materials to withstand the rigors of climbing.

name: Map and Compass
description: A map and compass set is essential for any adventurer navigating through uncharted territories. The map is a detailed representation of the surrounding area, marked with landmarks, paths, and potential dangers, while the compass provides direction, ensuring that the adventurer can find their way back or explore new routes with confidence.

name: Healer's Kit
description: A healer's kit is a collection of medical supplies and tools, including bandages, salves, and herbs, used by adventurers to treat wounds and ailments. It is essential for any party venturing into dangerous territories, providing the means to stabilize and heal injured companions.

name: Tent
description: A tent is a portable shelter made of fabric or other materials, supported by poles and secured to the ground with stakes. It provides protection from the elements, making it an essential item for adventurers who need a place to rest and recuperate during their journeys.

name: Mirror
description: A polished glass mirror set in a decorative frame, capable of reflecting images clearly. It is often used by adventurers for grooming, but some believe it can reveal hidden truths or even show glimpses of the future.

name: 10-Foot Pole
description: A sturdy wooden pole measuring ten feet in length, often used by adventurers to probe for traps, cross chasms, or as a makeshift lever. Its length makes it versatile for various tasks in exploration and dungeon delving.

name: Blanket or Bedroll
description: A warm and durable blanket or bedroll made from thick wool or canvas, designed to provide comfort and insulation during rest. It can be easily rolled up for transport and is essential for adventurers camping in the wilderness.

name: Flint and Steel
description: Flint and steel is a simple yet essential tool for starting fires. It consists of a piece of flint, a hard stone that can create sparks when struck, and a steel striker that produces a shower of sparks when scraped against the flint. This combination is vital for adventurers in the wild, allowing them to cook food, stay warm, and ward off dangers in the dark.

name: Potion Vials
description: Potion vials are small glass containers used to hold various potions and elixirs. They come in different shapes and sizes, often with cork or wax seals to prevent spillage. The vials are typically labeled to indicate their contents, which can range from healing potions to toxic substances.

name: Sack or Bag
description: A simple sack or bag made from sturdy cloth or leather, used for carrying various items. It is versatile and can hold anything from food supplies to adventuring gear, making it an essential item for any traveler.

name: Spyglass
description: A spyglass is a compact telescope designed for long-distance viewing. It is typically made of polished brass and glass, allowing adventurers to scout distant locations, observe enemy movements, or admire the beauty of the landscape from afar.
